intro: Alectra chitrakutensis, commonly known as the Chitrakut velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and agricultural fields. It has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
